name: Courtyard Washington Capitol Hill/Navy Yard

reviews.text: I stayed here for one night in June. Initially, I selected this hotel because I thought it was fairly close to Capitol Hill and all the attractions in Washington DC. Only when I got there I realized it was not a good idea to walk to the Capitol Hill from the hotel. I don't know much about the neighbourhood in DC, but the location of the hotel gave me a distinct uncomfortable feeling -- there were no restaurants nearby, and I could see nobody walking on the streets. The hotel is facing an industrial/office building. In the end, I decided to drive to the Washington Mall, and it was a good decision.
reviews.title: Good hotel but not so good location

reviews.text: My room was quite nice. Though it was not big (by Marriott standards), but it was nicely arranged, so I have a desk, a love chair, and a coffee table, in addition to the queen-size bed. The complementary Internet service was nice. The hotel staff was also very helpful. I had a broken windshield wiper and was asking for an auto parts shop. They looked up the closest shop and gave me directions.
reviews.title: Below Average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint about this hotel, other than its location, is the poor sound proofing. At night, I could hear someone knocking on the neighbour's door, which made me uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Baseball Retreat

reviews.text: The underground parking cost $17/day, but you have unlimited entrance/exit access during the day. The space is quite limited though, so if you return late (I returned about 9pm), you will have to park on a spot with a raised platform, with another car either above yours or below. In such a case, you also needed to leave your key to the superintendent. If you are in a hurry to leave the next morning, it could be a problem. On the other hand, I think you have the choice of parking on the streets nearby with no charge.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel ... Great Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nothing special about this hotel. The lobby was over crowded with people because there is nothing to do around this hotel not even a fast food restraunt. The staff acted indifferently to customers but the rooms were ok.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
Great staff!
reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this place! Chose the hotel because of the location being close to the Nats Ballpark, but was pleasantly surprised about all I encountered. Every staff member that I met was genuinely sincere and extremely helpful during my 3-day stay! My compliments to Jennifer and the staff at the front desk!

Prior to our trip to the DC area I read a lot of Trip Advisor reviews and this hotel seemed to have many favorable reviews. Attending a Washington Nationals game was one of the activities we had planned. Our trip was short so we only had time for a trip to one specific museum. Those activities considered this hotel really fit the bill for us. It is new, reasonably priced, reasonable parking fees, close to the ball park, and close to a Metro stop. In fact from the hotel you can see both the park and the Metro station.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay and would consider staying again

likes.disliked: — Not walking distance to the museums

reviews.text: The hotel is in an “up and coming” area. We felt comfortable walking to and from the ball park because there were so many people in the area during the game. We also felt very comfortable walking to and from the Metro stop in the daytime. I took my son to the corner CVS at 9pm to grab a snack and some other items. I felt a bit uneasy doing this both in the walking as well as inside the CVS. I think it is a bit of a distance from the museums, monuments and mall. I would not walk to those places but it is very easy & quick to get there via the Metro.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, great staff!

likes.disliked: — More in the area would have been nice, but thats not the hotels fault.

reviews.text: A quick mention about the Metro – each time we were in the Navy Yard metro stop we were approached by a Metro employee to ask if we need help or directions. They were always very helpful with precise directions. We saw them talking to many different groups of tourists. In an urban area we thought this was fantastic Metro, Washington PR!
reviews.title: Hated to leave!

likes.liked: — It's a beautiful, comfortable hotel one block to a Metro stop and a CVS drugstore
likes.disliked: — Needs more bars,restaurants and shopping nearby

reviews.text: The hotel lobby was very clean and welcoming. It was hot during our stay & the lobby AC was a wonderful welcome! The hotel is on the new side so everything was in working order and looked fresh. There are three computers in the lobby for guests to use and they all worked well. The hotel was very crowded when we stayed. The Nationals had home games and this is a very popular place to stay for the baseball fans. Check in had a bit of a line. The general manager saw the line & hopped on a computer and started checking in guests.
reviews.title: Thanks from AKA's of Florida

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for two nights, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay! When I first arrived, I was a little skeptical about the location, mainly because there wasn't much around for entertainment and restaurants. However, most things are in close proximity. We went into Georgetown for dinner, and the drive was not bad! The front desk staff was extremely professional and accomodating! The room was fantastic! The bed was especially comfortable, and the overall cleanliness of the room and hotel was excellent! I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to DC!
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel with extremely professional staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel, though not in the actual downtown area, was only a block from the navy yard metro station, a very quick two minute walk. there is a CVS pharmacy right on the corner, very convenient for getting snacks or other supplies. The staff was excellent, no matter the time of day. Room was clean and well decorated, flat screen TV was nice. The only downside is the lack of restaurants nearby, but hotel food was good. Restaurant food was above average. A little tip: instead of room service, order your food and run down to get it...price of each item is a dollar lower, and there is no automatic gratuity or mark-up. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great Value

likes.liked: — value, proximity to metro, staff service

reviews.text: Spent five nights here with my wife and two children (ages 5 and 7). The pool is nice (not real warm!) but the hot tub/whirlpool was great! The exercise area is small but wasn't crowded and had a bike and some treadmills with a large-screen TV on the wall. Rooms were new and nice with an empty mini-fridge (not a mini-bar fridge that's already full). We walked a shor block to the nearby corner drugstore and got milk, cerial, paper bowls, and plastic spoons and had in-room breakfast every morning! Not many restaurants within a block or so - just a Subway and a burger place (good burgers though). There are many restaurants about a mile away along 8th street to the east.
reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Price

likes.liked: — Close to a Metro stop and good price for DC
likes.disliked: — Parking is a bit cramped and Internet speed could be faster

reviews.text: The bathroom is bright and the water is instantly hot and provides a great shower. The beds were comfortable. The big-screen HD TV was quite nice with several full HD channels available on cable (not just the stretch-to-fit standard channels).
reviews.title: Nice hotel in unusual location

reviews.text: Internet acces in the rooms is wired (not wireless) and a short cable is provided in the room. The connection is free but seemed a bit slow at times. There are three computers in the lobby which are hooked to a laser printer where you can get to the Internet and print boarding passes, etc.
reviews.title: BAD front desk service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in mid-Sept 08 to see Nats baseball games plus sightseeing. We were 2 adults in a 3rd floor 'regular' ("low price") room. Here's what you should know:
reviews.title: Great for Baseball & Sights- Take Notice though...

likes.liked: — Proximity to baseball park and Metro

reviews.title: Nice hotel, convienient to Navy Yard
reviews.text: Cons: Mattresses very mushy; not the nice firm hotel type I'm used to! There are NO mirrors in the room, just 2 in the bathroom. The large LCD TV sits on top of the dresser, eating up most of the counter top space. Inconvenient for 2 or more people who need to spread out their stuff! There's ample blank wall space without artwork, mirrors, anything...where the TV should be mounted. A/C unit was as noisy as units I've had in 40 year old hotels; I can't believe modern technology hasn't made a quiet hotel A/C unit yet. And lastly, your in-room coffee maker is a piece of crap. The water doesn't pass thru the coffee pod; it just builds up in the reservoir and makes a mess. Considering that this hotel either doesn't provide free lobby coffee OR keeps it a secret, coffee lovers will be sad. Room service ends at either 10 or 11 pm, which is a bit early for a hotel of this caliber.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS: Intelligent front desk staff. Very clean room. Excellent shower and good light in the bathroom. Good size refrig. Nice pull-out table that fits under desk. Clean pool and excellent whirlpool spa. You must bring a bathing suit as you'll adore the spa after a long day sightseeing! Free under-hotel parking and they give you 2 free hours after your noon check out time. Absolutely delicious, perfect Angus burger for you meat-eaters! And yes, you can walk to the ballpark but be careful after night games. Stay with the crowd. I took some extra time at the park after a game and ended up on a deserted street. Was ambushed by a scary street guy-he just asked for a handout, but it could've been worse. Daytime is completely opposite as the area is buzzing with respectable working people. Enjoy the close-by Metro station and all the beauty DC has to offer.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: This hotel is pretty new, and the room was great. Very clean and new. The exercise room is small, but not crowded. They also had enough computers in the business center so it wasn't busy. The food in the resturant was pretty bad, and there was no continental breakfast. One word about the parking garage - there are no exit signs or arrows, so all the sudden you're at a dead end and have to back up around corners and turns, it was terrible. There aren't any resturants around except for Subway and a burger place, but it was close to the Navy Yard Metro stop, right across the street.
reviews.title: Great experience for our group!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent a long weekend in DC. We chose the Courtyard based on other Trip Advisor reviews. It’s a fairly new hotel, but the area is still growing. We never felt unsafe since there were always groups of people walking to and from the Metro stop. The rooms were clean. The beds were comfortable, and to my wife’s delight, there were many pillows (6). The staff was friendly and helpful. We ate the breakfast buffet each morning. It’s $10.00, but I swear the omelet was at least 4-5 eggs, and it was very good.

aka: Courtyard Washington Capitol Hill/Navy Yard Hotel
description: Get away to one of the most beautiful Washington, D.C., hotels on Capitol Hill! Our modern accommodations and attentive staff will provide you with the perfect home away from home!Conveniently located near Nationals Park and local attractions such as monuments, museums and the US Capitol in the up and coming Capitol Riverfront neighborhood. We are in the heart of Washington, DC office buildings such as Lockheed Martin, Northrup Grumman, Parsons, BAE Systems, General Dynamics and Booz Allen Hamilton just to name a few. We are also surrounded by government agencies such as the US Department of Transportation, DC Health and Family Services, Bureau of Land Management and convenient to the Navy Yard, Joint Base Anacostia Bolling and Ft. McNair. The striking and modern Courtyard by Marriott Capitol Hill/Navy Yard is ideal for business and leisure travelers alike. Top among hotels near Capitol Hill, we offer 2,215 square feet of meeting space that can accommodate up to 180 guests, plus on-site catering from The Bistro - Eat. Drink. Connect. Enjoy breakfast in the mornings from with delicious Starbucks® coffee or relax with a glass of wine in the evening from The Bistro. You can also stay active during your stay with an on-site 24-hour fitness center, offering cardiovascular equipment, an indoor pool and whirlpool. Our lobby features all of the amenities that saavy travelers have come to expect such as FREE WIFI, a quick print station for your boarding pass to save you time at the airport, comfortable in-room work areas with conveniently located outlets and lighting and a 24-hour business center with a library. The modern lobby would not be complete however without our state-of-the-art GoBoard® that offers directions, up to the minute flight and weather information and information on local attractions with the ability to print you directions! It’s personalized service available at your fingertips!
